name: Fane Spirit
description: The Fane Spirit embodies the essence of those who were once living, shifting between incorporeal and living forms, appearing much as it did in life during the day.
memorable: Its ability to make targets forget recent events makes it a complex challenge for adventurers.
goals: To engage with the living, often manipulating memories or seeking to protect sacred spaces.
relations: May be encountered alongside other undead or spirits, often associated with places of rest or memorials.
environment: Typically found in graveyards, sacred sites, or areas of great spiritual significance.
strengths: Resistant to many damage types and immune to various conditions, enhancing combat survivability.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to damage from silvered weapons and has a low walking speed.
attacks: The Touch of Forgetfulness inflicts psychic damage and can erase memories of recent events from the target.
most_powerful_ability: The Veil of the Living allows the spirit to appear as it did in life, creating thematic tension during encounters.
senses: Possesses darkvision up to 60 feet and a passive perception of 14, allowing it to notice details.
skills: Proficient in deception and religion, useful for manipulation and knowledge checks.
additional_information: Has immunity to poison and psychic damage.
Uses spells like Cure Wounds and Hold Person strategically.
Can revert to its incorporeal form upon taking damage, instilling fear in onlookers.
Innate spellcasting ability allows for flexibility in combat and healing.
Gains a Strength score of 10 during the day, enhancing its combat abilities temporarily.
spellcasting: Can cast spells like Chill Touch and Spare the Dying at will, with several healing and control options available daily.
test_queries: undead that shifts forms during the day

spirit that can heal and harm simultaneously
